This decision could lead to rule changes and compensation for affected players. FIFA indicated it will review the decision with stakeholders. The ruling may result in reduced transfer fees and increased economic power for players, impacting clubs' financial stability.

Pakistan plans several tours in the coming months.

He cited the significant workload and his desire to prioritize his performance and personal life. Mohammad Rizwan is expected to be his successor. Mayank Yadav claims maiden international wicket - WATCH

title: Can Indian pacers pack a mean punch in Australia?
description: Despite a recent series loss to New Zealand, India's formidable pace attack, spearheaded by Jasprit Bumrah, is poised to challenge Australia in the upcoming Border Gavaskar Trophy. The bouncy Australian pitches are expected to favor India's fast bowlers, potentially exploiting weaknesses in the Australian batting lineup.

title: 'I am surprised that...': India's BGT preparation baffles Vaughan
description: India has chosen to forego their only warm-up match against India 'A' ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, a decision that has surprised former England captain Michael Vaughan. Instead, the team focused on net sessions and an intra-squad match at Perth's WACA Stadium, aiming to acclimatize to the bouncy pitches in Western Australia.

title: 'Virat Kohli annoyed me with his comments that night'
description: Former Australian pacer Mitchell Johnson reminisced about his on-field rivalry with Virat Kohli during the 2014-15 Border Gavaskar Trophy. Johnson admitted to strategically trying to provoke Kohli, aiming to disrupt his focus. Despite their attempts, Kohli went on to score four centuries on the tour, including a magnificent 169 in Melbourne after a dropped catch fueled his determination.

title: Virat Kohli set to go past Rahul Dravid
description: Indian cricket captain Virat Kohli is on the verge of surpassing Rahul Dravid's record for most runs against Australia in Test matches. Kohli needs just 102 runs to overtake Dravid's 2,143 runs. Currently, Kohli sits fifth among Indian batsmen with the most runs against Australia, boasting an impressive average of 47.48 with eight centuries.

title: We got what we wanted out of three-day match stimulation: Nayar
description: The Indian cricket team is confident and well-prepared for the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. They completed a three-day match simulation at the WACA Ground, focusing on adapting to the conditions. Bowling coach Morne Morkel expressed satisfaction with the bowlers' performance during practice, and the team is now focused on strategizing for the first Test match on November 22nd.

title: 'Chhup ke practice': Basit Ali mocks Team India's preparation
description: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali believes Team India's decision to practice behind closed doors ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy signifies a lack of confidence. He suggests India should have played more warm-up matches and advises Virat Kohli to prepare against left-arm fast bowling. Basit is eager to witness the run-scoring battle between Kohli and Steve Smith in the series.

title: 'Pushing undercooked Shami won't be fair'
description: Former Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra has advised against rushing Mohammed Shami back into Test cricket for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Despite a promising return in a recent Ranji Trophy match, Chopra believes Shami needs more time to regain full fitness and form after a year-long injury layoff. He cautioned that playing Shami in Australia's demanding conditions so soon could risk further injury.

title: India vs Australia 1st Test, Perth Weather Report
description: India is gearing up to face Australia in the first Test of the five-match Border-Gavaskar Trophy series in Perth, starting on November 22. Aiming for a historic third consecutive series win in Australia, India is looking to secure at least four Test victories to qualify for the World Test Championship final in 2025.

title: Watch: 'Legend' Siraj gets a kiss, praise from Team India bowling coach
description: The Indian cricket team is gearing up for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy with intense training in Perth. Mohammed Siraj received high praise from bowling coach Morne Morkel. Shubman Gill will miss the first Test due to injury, while a fit-again KL Rahul will feature in the series opener. Captain Rohit Sharma will join the team for the second Test.

title: 'Batting with one hand': No.11 batter's show of courage - Watch
description: Australian cricketer Ashton Agar displayed remarkable courage in the Sheffield Shield match, batting one-handed despite a shoulder injury. Coming in at number 11 for Western Australia, he endured pain to support centurion Joel Curtis, adding vital runs for the last wicket. Although his brave effort couldn't prevent Western Australia's loss to Victoria, Agar's determination earned him widespread admiration.

title: 'Gautam Gambhir's anger and patience will be tested'
description: Former Indian cricketer Gautam Gambhir faces mounting pressure as head coach following a series of disappointing losses for the Indian cricket team. Former teammate Harbhajan Singh acknowledges the challenges of the role and emphasizes the significance of the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia as a critical test for Gambhir's leadership and composure.

title: 'Kapil Dev can't be bigger than anyone else'
description: Former Indian cricket captain Kapil Dev emphasised that the government should decide on matters like ICC Champions Trophy 2025 venues and India-Pakistan matches. This follows the ICC's decision to move the 2025 Champions Trophy tour from Pakistan-occupied Jammu-Kashmir (PoJK) to other locations after objections from the BCCI.

title: Sinner sweeps past Fritz to win ATP Finals
description: Jannik Sinner made history by clinching his first ATP Finals title with a convincing victory over Taylor Fritz in Turin. The 23-year-old Italian dominated the match, winning in straight sets, 6-4, 6-4, to cap off a stellar year.

title: Mendis guides Sri Lanka to ODI series win over NZ
description: Kusal Mendis' unbeaten 74 guided Sri Lanka to a three-wicket victory over New Zealand in the second ODI, securing a series win. Mendis' heroics came despite a groin injury and a challenging target of 210 runs. Sri Lankan spinners restricted New Zealand to 209, setting up their fifth bilateral series victory in 2024.

title: Rain washes out England's final T20I in West Indies
description: The fifth T20I between West Indies and England in St. Lucia was abandoned due to heavy rain, resulting in England winning the series 3-1. West Indies, at 44-0 in 5 overs when the rain came, had won the previous match to avoid a series whitewash. England captain Jos Buttler expressed satisfaction with his team's return to winning ways.

title: Devdutt Padikkal to stay back, Harshit Rana likely to make debut in Perth
description: With Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill unavailable for the first Test against Australia, India has called up Devdutt Padikkal as batting backup. Jasprit Bumrah will captain the team in Rohit's absence. Additionally, uncapped pacer Harshit Rana may make his Test debut in Perth, having impressed during recent matches and net sessions.

title: 'Strongly refutes': PCB dismisses reports on Gillespie's removal
description: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) refuted claims of Jason Gillespie's departure as head coach, confirming his commitment through the South Africa series. Despite Gillespie's successes, including victories against England and Australia, rumors circulated about his potential replacement with Aaqib Javed. This situation highlights the PCB's history of frequent coaching changes, raising concerns about stability ahead of major tournaments.

title: Gavaskar predicts Iyer's future in IPL 2025 auction

description: A detailed assessment of the hurricane damage to Tropicana Field concludes that the home of the Rays is structurally sound and can be repaired in time for the 2026 season, but not by 2025 Opening Day.

title: Lakers' Anthony Davis says his eye is fine, declines to wear goggles
description: Los Angeles Lakers star Anthony Davis says he has recovered from being poked in the left eye by Toronto’s Jakob Poeltl, and his latest eye injury still hasn’t persuaded him to wear protective goggles

title: Bears fire offensive coordinator Shane Waldron amid QB Caleb Williams' struggles
description: The Chicago Bears have fired offensive coordinator Shane Waldron in hopes of shaking up a unit that ranks among the worst in the NFL.

title: 2024 NFL odds: Can the Kansas City Chiefs go undefeated?
description: The Chiefs are 9-0, heading to Buffalo for a huge AFC showdown. Can Mahomes & Co. pull off the unlikely? Check out the odds.

title: The surprising rise of Jayden Daniels shouldn't have been a surprise at all
description: To hear Kliff Kingsbury tell it, Jayden Daniels struggles with the "trash can drill." But that's about the only thing the Commanders standout hasn't excelled at in his rookie season.

title: NFL Week 10 odds: 'Woulda, Coulda, Shoulda' parlay; five bets that would've won big
description: Patrick Everson recaps how parlaying a few obvious NFL wagers could've netted you some big time cash in Week 10.
